snippet: Dr. Thomas R. Frieden and Dr. Jonathan Mermin, the C.D.C.’s chief of AIDS prevention, paint a bleak picture of the fight against the disease in an essay in The New England Journal of Medicine.
abstract: Dr Thomas R Frieden, director of Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, reports in New England Journal of Medicine that United States remains in peril of losing war on AIDS because hundreds of thousands of Americans diagnosed with HIV infection are not receiving medical care or antiretroviral therapies; report calls for radical changes in how disease is fought but notes transition would primarily come from state and local health departments, over which CDC has little power.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Thomas R. Frieden and Dr. Jonathan Mermin, the C.D.C.’s chief of AIDS prevention, paint a bleak picture of the fight against the disease in an essay in The New England Journal of Medicine.
